meanings.definition: A heading at the top of an article or page in a newspaper or magazine.
meanings.sent1: The headlines on the newspaper were big and bold.
meanings.sent2: I always read the headlines first to know what's happening.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat on the newspaper, blocking the headlines from view.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a headline, drawing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The headlines screamed of a major event.

meanings.definition: A line of text at the top of a news article summarizing the main point.
meanings.sent1: The headlines of the article were short and informative.
meanings.sent2: The headlines gave a quick overview of the news story.
meanings.sent3: The headlines were so catchy, they made me want to read more.
meanings.sent4: His words hit me like a powerful headline, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The headlines captured the essence of the story perfectly.

meanings.definition: To be the main subject or feature of a news story.
meanings.sent1: The scandal headlines the news today.
meanings.sent2: The new movie will headlines the entertainment section.
meanings.sent3: His funny dance moves headlines the school talent show.
meanings.sent4: Her bravery headlines the local hero stories.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious disappearance headlines the town gossip.
